properties.areaDesc: Wyoming Black Hills; Central Black Hills; Northern Black Hills
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 30 at 9:32AM MST until January 30 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Rapid City SD
properties.description:
...PERIOD OF HEAVY SNOW IN THE NORTHERN BLACK HILLS TODAY...

.A strong upper trough will push through the region today,
supporting periods of moderate to heavy snow in the Northern
Black Hills. Snow amounts of 3 to 5 inches are expected, with
isolated higher amounts possible from Lead to Cheyenne Crossing,
and also in the Bearlodge Mountains. The heaviest snow is
expected this afternoon. Gusty northwest winds will also support
areas of blowing and drifting snow this afternoon.

* WHAT...Snow. Snow accumulations 3 to 6 inches. Highest snow
accumulations from Lead to Cheyenne Crossing. Lowest
accumulations southeast of a Rochford to Deerfield line,
generally less than 2 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph.

* WHERE...In South Dakota, the Central Black Hills and the
Northern Black Hills. In Wyoming, the Wyoming Black Hills.

* WHEN...Until 5 PM MST this afternoon.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing
snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous
conditions could impact the evening commute.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON
